titleStmt.title: High resolution powder X-ray diffraction study of UiO12

analytic.title: High resolution powder X-ray diffraction study of UiO12

div.p: Report: High-resolution powder patterns were collected on two layered aluminophosphates UiO-25 and UiO-30.

div.head: UiO-25:
div.p: The crystal structure could be solved from direct methods using the program EXTRA. A monoclinic unit cell: a = 21.7487(6)Å, b = 9.3649(2), c = 9.7738(2) and β = 93.260(2) o in space group C2/c. UiO-25, 0.5[NH 2 CH 3 ][NH 3 CH 3 ] + [HAl 2 P 2 O 9 ] -, is a hybrid organic-inorganic structure with inorganic, anionic layers of aluminophosphates stacked in a ABAB sequence along [100] separated by partly protonated methylamine molecules (Fig. 1). The atomic arrangement in the inorganic layers are identical to that in UiO-13 and UiO-14 [1]. UiO-25 and the two structurally related compounds have been further characterized by high-field (14.1 T) solid-state 1-D 27 Al MAS NMR and 2D 3QMAS NMR spectroscopy. A publication focusing both on the synchrotron powder diffraction data and the NMR data is in preparation.
[1] K.O. Kongshaug, H. Fjellvåg, K.P. Lillerud, Micrporous Mesoporous Mater. 32 (1999) 17.

UiO-30: No structure for this aluminophosphate compound has been found. 27 Al MAS NMR spectroscopy indicates one octahedral Al site. Further work will be done to solve the structure for this compound.

figure.head: Figure 1 .
figure.figDesc: Figure 1. Polyhedral representation of UiO-25 seen along [001]. AlO 5 trigonal bipyramids with darker shading, PO 4 tetrahedra with lighter shading, C atoms with open cicles and N atoms with solid cicles.
